definitions.definition: An act of stamping the foot, paw or hoof.
definitions.example: The horse gave two quick stamps and rose up on its hind legs.

definitions.definition: An indentation, imprint, or mark made by stamping.
definitions.example: My passport has quite a collection of stamps.
She loved to make designs with her collection of stamps.

definitions.definition: A small piece of paper bearing a design on one side and adhesive on the other, used to decorate letters or craft work.
definitions.example: These stamps have a Christmas theme.

definitions.definition: A small piece of paper, with a design and a face value, used to prepay postage or other costs such as tax or licence fees.
definitions.example: I need one first-class stamp to send this letter.

definitions.definition: A single dose of lysergic acid diethylamide.
A kind of heavy pestle, raised by water or steam power, for crushing ores.
Cast; form; character; distinguishing mark or sign; evidence.
To step quickly and heavily, once or repeatedly.
definitions.example: The toddler screamed and stamped, but still got no candy.

definitions.definition: To move (the foot or feet) quickly and heavily, once or repeatedly.
definitions.example: The crowd cheered and stamped their feet in appreciation.

definitions.definition: To strike, beat, or press forcibly with the bottom of the foot, or by thrusting the foot downward.
To mark by pressing quickly and heavily.
definitions.example: This machine stamps the design into the metal cover.

definitions.definition: To give an official marking to, generally by impressing or imprinting a design or symbol.
definitions.example: The immigration officer stamped my passport.
I forgot to stamp this letter.
